definitions.definition: A bend; turn; curve; curvature; a flexure.
definitions.example: She held the baby in the crook of her arm.

definitions.definition: A bending of the knee; a genuflection.
A bent or curved part; a curving piece or portion (of anything).
A lock or curl of hair.
A support beam consisting of a post with a cross-beam resting upon it; a bracket or truss consisting of a vertical piece, a horizontal piece, and a strut.
A shepherd's crook; a staff with a semi-circular bend ("hook") at one end used by shepherds.
An artifice; a trick; a contrivance.
A person who steals, lies, cheats or does other dishonest or illegal things; a criminal.
A small tube, usually curved, applied to a trumpet, horn, etc., to change its pitch or key.
To bend, or form into a hook.
definitions.example: He crooked his finger toward me.

definitions.definition: To turn from the path of rectitude; to pervert; to misapply; to twist.
Bad, unsatisfactory, not up to standard.
definitions.example: Not turning up for training was pretty crook.
be crook at/about; go crook at
